title: Is it just me? Or is chatting to your hairdresser one of life's greatest joys? asks LIZ HOGGARD
text:
In a world where we text rather than speak on the phone, and prefer social media to small talk, it’s perhaps not surprising that you can now book silent haircuts.

London’s Not Another Salon claims to be the world’s first to offer a service that allows you to opt out of chit-chat.

According to owner Sophia Hilton, your stylist will talk you through your consultation, but the rest of the time is yours. It’s the latest development in self-care (much loved by our younger colleagues).

Liz Hoggard questions the introduction of hair salons that offer silent haircuts, such as London’s Not Another Salon (file image)

But are they barking mad? Going to the hairdresser is the most fun you can have with your clothes on.

Thanks to stylists over the years, I have heard the best gossip and been introduced to fascinating fellow clients (film directors, chefs, even one future prime minister) while in the salon chair. I’ve taken recommendations for great novels and restaurants, for doctors and kinesiologists when my hair was thinning, and I’ve even had my tears discreetly mopped up during romantic crises.

A blow-dry can be life-changing — and often much cheaper than therapy

At Hari’s salon, where they do my henna colour, I can see Benedict Cumberbatch undergo a brutal trim (to play Richard III) or Saoirse Ronan as she’s about to have her hair dyed pink, and I can gossip about it in situ.

But more than this, I love the easy chatter. It’s a silly cliche that hairdressers are capable only of asking about holidays. Most have great life experience which they’re happy to share (just avoid debates about Brexit and real fur).

Some people may find silence blissful, but for me it’s a sign of disapproval. If my fringe looks terrible, I want to know. But I also want us to share triumphs and failures together, as human beings. A blow-dry can be life-changing — and often far cheaper than therapy.
description: Liz Hoggard believes that talking to your hairdresser is one of life's great joys. London's Not Another Salon is the world's first to offer silent haircuts. Liz argues a blow-dry can be cheaper than therapy.
authors: Liz Hoggard For The Daily Mail
